oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Saber and scabbard of Capt. Samuel Rankin Latta
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Saber belonged to Capt. Samuel Rankin Latta (1827-1910). Latta was of Irish descent. He was reared in Pennsylvania and moved to Dyersburg, Tenn., where he was a lawyer, teacher, Presbyterian elder, Sunday school superintendent, and Mason. Latta married Mary Guthrie (1833-1920) on Dec. 9, 1852. He was commissioned in June 1861 and served as captain in the 13th Tenn. Vol. Inf. Regt., CSA. He is buried in Dyer County, Tenn. W. H. Horseman of Philadelphia, Pa., made the sword.
